meanings.definition: Hellhounds: fierce and malevolent supernatural dogs believed to guard the entrance to the underworld.
meanings.sent1: The villagers whispered about the terrifying hellhounds lurking in the shadows.
meanings.sent2: Legends speak of hellhounds with eyes that glow in the darkness.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled, imagining tiny hellhounds guarding their toy castle.
meanings.sent4: The howls of the hellhounds echoed through the night, sending shivers down their spines.
meanings.sent5: In the old tales, heroes faced the hellhounds with bravery and cunning.

meanings.definition: Hellhounds: a pack of mythical creatures that are said to hunt lost souls in the afterlife.
meanings.sent1: The storyteller described the hellhounds chasing after the wandering spirits.
meanings.sent2: In folklore, the hellhounds are relentless in their pursuit of the souls of the departed.
meanings.sent3: The artist painted a whimsical scene of hellhounds playing fetch with ghostly souls.
meanings.sent4: The howling of the hellhounds signaled the approach of the lost souls' reckoning.
meanings.sent5: The image of the hellhounds haunted the dreams of those who dared to listen to the tales.
